Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is complex and difficult for the average citizen to understand, potentially requiring legal assistance to navigate.
The bill appears to limit free speech and regulate what can be said by Australian citizens and businesses on digital platforms.
The legislation is seen as unfair and discriminatory because it exempts government bodies and non-citizens from its provisions.
The bill could be an attempt to suppress criticism of the government.
Existing laws already cover misinformation, and additional legislation may be unnecessary.
The bill does not account for the challenges posed by anonymous online activity and the use of VPNs.
Notable Quotes: It seems to me that the proposed bill is wide and far reaching, but it does not explain in plain English exactly what is meant.
If this Bill is necessary legislation, then it should apply to every person living in Australia, all businesses, and to all Government bodies.
Is 1984 is alive and well in the minds of those who created and proposed this bill?
The expression of views, without incitement or violence, is part of a healthy democracy.
